member.summary: Encapsulates the type of coordinates used by the region.

member.name: F:Applitools.Utils.Geometry.CoordinatesTypeEnum.SCREENSHOT_AS_IS
member.summary: The coordinates should be used "as is" on the screenshot image, regardless of the current context.

member.name: F:Applitools.Utils.Geometry.CoordinatesTypeEnum.CONTEXT_AS_IS
member.summary: The coordinates should be used "as is" within the current context. For example, if we're inside a frame, the coordinates are "as is", but within the current frame's viewport.

member.name: F:Applitools.Utils.Geometry.CoordinatesTypeEnum.CONTEXT_RELATIVE
member.summary: Coordinates are relative to the context. For example, if we are in a context of a frame in a web page, then the coordinates are relative to the frame. In this case, if we want to crop an image region based on an element's region, we will need to calculate their respective "as is" coordinates.

members.member:
Compresses a target image by saving its differences from a source image.
Compressed image streams have the following format: [0-9] applitools [10] compression format [11-12] source image id length (in bytes) [13-] id (UTF8 encoded) [] format specific encoding.

A class used to compensate for region offsets in various browsers.
The time to wait before a call for capturing a screenshot. Used mainly for allowing the page to stabilize after a position was set.
An object responsible for storing the intermediate images created in the process, for debugging purposes.
The function used to create an object from the actual screenshot image.

A position provider used for saving the state before starting the stitching, as well as moving to (0,0). The reason it is separated from the stitchProvideris that the stitchProvider might have side-effects (e.g., changing the CSS transform of the page can cause a layout change at the top of the page), which we can avoid for the first screenshot (since it might be a full page screenshot anyway).
The scale provider factory.
The cut provider used for custom cropping.
The amount of pixels to overlap when stitching.
The screenshot image provider.
